insight.title: Insight

method.aciditySweetness: methods that highlight acidity and sweetness, such as V60 or Chemex
method.sweetnessBody: methods that enhance body, such as French Press or AeroPress
method.acidity: filter methods that highlight acidity, such as V60
method.body: immersion methods such as French Press or AeroPress
method.versatile: versatile methods such as V60 or AeroPress

insight.template: Coffee with {sweetness} and {acidity}. The {fragrance}, but the {aftertaste}, which indicates {interpretation}. Ideal for {method}.

origin.colombia: balanced profiles, medium-high acidity and clean sweetness
origin.brazil: high body, chocolate and nutty notes
origin.costaRica: high sweetness, medium acidity, clean cups

variety.mundoNovo: full body, good balance, moderate acidity, chocolate notes
variety.catuai: medium-high acidity, juicy, notable sweetness, caramel and chocolate notes
variety.pacamara: giant bean, complex flavor, fruity, bright acidity, full body
variety.maragogype: very large bean, light body, soft acidity, delicate and clean profile
variety.sl28: citric and bright acidity (blackcurrant), juicy, tropical notes, tea-like profile
variety.sl34: dense and round body, citric acidity, spicy, heavier mouthfeel than SL28
variety.ruiru11: consistent quality, good balance, disease resistant
variety.ethiopianHeirloom: floral, intensely fruity, complex acidity (bergamot/citric), tea-like
variety.sidamo: balanced, medium body, wine and berry notes, spiced sweetness
variety.yirgacheffe: intensely floral (jasmine), bright acidity (lemon), very clean
variety.harrar: naturally processed, blackberry, wine, dried fruit notes, rustic/spicy character
variety.java: good body, medium-low acidity, spice and chocolate notes, clean profile
variety.sumatra: heavy body and low acidity, earthy, tobacco, cocoa, robust profile
variety.sulawesi: full body, soft acidity, nutty, cocoa, spicy notes
variety.blueMountain: extreme smoothness, notable sweetness, no bitterness, medium body, clean
variety.villaSarchi: intense and bright acidity, sweetness, good balance, medium body

process.natural: higher sweetness, ripe fruit, greater body

roastLevel.light: high acidity, more brightness, more origin

roastDate.veryFresh: May be very fresh, incomplete aroma development.
roastDate.aging: Aroma and body may be starting to degrade.

0-3.title: Very fresh (0-3 days)
0-3.description: High degassing, intense but less defined aromas, pronounced acidity. Ideal for evaluating freshness, not clarity.

4-10.title: Developing (4-10 days)
4-10.description: Moderate degassing, more defined aromas, more controlled acidity. Stable extraction, ideal for complete cupping.

11-20.title: Optimal (11-20 days)
11-20.description: Low degassing, very defined aromas, developed sweetness, balanced body. Balanced profile ideal for comparative cupping.

21-30.title: Stable (21-30 days)
21-30.description: Coffee completely settled, round and stable profile. Ideal for daily consumption and consistent evaluation.

30+.title: Aged (more than 30 days)
30+.description: Volatile aromas are lost, muted acidity, less vibrant. Stable but may feel flat in delicate methods.

penalties.nonUniform: Penalties slightly reduce uniformity, which may indicate inconsistency in grinding or roasting.
penalties.defective: Detected defects affect the profile's cleanliness, making it less stable.
penalties.both: Penalties and detected defects reduce the profile's uniformity and cleanliness, indicating possible inconsistencies in grinding or roasting.

insight.templateWithContext: Coffee from {origin}, {altitudeInfo}with a {process} process with a {roastLevel} roast level. {roastDateInfo}Highlighted by {strongestPoint} and {acidity}. {fragrance}, but the {aftertaste}, which indicates {interpretation}. {methodNote}{penaltiesNote}

methodNote.v60: highlights clarity, bright acidity, and floral notes
methodNote.chemex: accentuates extreme cleanliness and soft sweetness, slightly reducing body
methodNote.espresso: intensifies body, aromatic concentration, and overall intensity
methodNote.aeropress: produces balanced cups, softening acidity and highlighting sweetness and body
methodNote.frenchPress: emphasizes body, texture, and the deeper notes
methodNote.cupping: shows the pure profile of the coffee without interference, highlighting attributes and defects

interpretation.expressive: a more expressive but less uniform profile

sections.processRoast: Processed using {process}, which contributes {processEffect}, and roasted to a {roastLevel} level, which {roastEffect}
sections.strengths: It stands out for {attributes}, which define much of its sensory character
sections.weakness: The {attribute} is the most subtle point, which may suggest {interpretation}
sections.method: Prepared with {method}, this method tends to {methodEffect}, complementing its natural characteristics

weaknessInterpretation.fragrance: a less aromatic profile at the start

coffeeInfo.modalSubtitle: Complete this data to improve the analysis

origin.label: What country is the coffee from?

altitude.label: At what altitude is it grown?

veryHigh.description: Slow maturation due to cold climate. Denser bean. Higher concentration of sugars and acids. Bright acidity (citric/fruity), complex flavors (floral, fruity), light to medium body.

high.description: Slow maturation due to cold climate. Denser bean. Higher concentration of sugars and acids. Bright acidity (citric/fruity), complex flavors (floral, fruity), light to medium body.

medium.description: Requires cooler and more stable climate. Higher quality, finer and more aromatic flavor.

low.description: Fast maturation. Less dense bean. Fewer sugars and acids. Low or soft acidity, flatter flavors, neutral or "roasted" notes, heavier body.

veryLow.description: Grows faster, tolerates more heat and humidity. More rustic, bitter taste, less acidic, high in caffeine.

brewingMethod.label: What method did you use to cup it?

roastDate.label: How many days have passed since roasting?
